definitions.definition: A payment made by a tenant at intervals in order to occupy a property.
A similar payment for the use of equipment or a service.
A profit from possession of a valuable right, as a restricted license to engage in a trade or business.
definitions.example: A New York city taxicab license earns more than $10,000 a year in rent.

definitions.definition: An object for which rent is charged or paid.
To occupy premises in exchange for rent.
definitions.example: I rented a house from my friend's parents for a year.

definitions.definition: To grant occupation in return for rent.
definitions.example: We rented our house to our son's friend for a year.

definitions.definition: To obtain or have temporary possession of an object (e.g. a movie) in exchange for money.
To be leased or let for rent.
definitions.example: The house rents for five hundred dollars a month.

definitions.definition: To separate into parts with force or sudden violence; to split; to burst
To part or tear off forcibly; to take away by force; to amputate.
To be rent or torn; to become parted; to separate; to split.
definitions.example: Relationships may rend if tempers flare.

definitions.definition: A tear or rip in some surface.
